travel_tip: The main cities on this route are Memphis and Little Rock. Try to pass through them outside of morning (7-9 AM) and evening (4-6 PM) rush hours to avoid potential delays on I-40.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. This is a good long charge to get to 85-90% to comfortably cross into Arkansas.

food_stops.name: Sizzler Cuisine of India
food_stops.description: An easygoing spot serving familiar and flavorful Indian dishes like curries and paratha rolls.

food_stops.name: Asia Garden
food_stops.description: A long-standing, award-winning local restaurant known for its large sushi rolls and extensive menu.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~30% SoC. This is a very quick top-off, just enough to add about 20% to ensure you reach Little Rock with a good buffer.

food_stops.name: Gene's BBQ
food_stops.description: A classic roadside BBQ joint for a quick, authentic taste of Arkansas.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~20% SoC. A solid 40-minute charge will get you back up to ~80% for the next leg of the trip.

food_stops.name: Taj Mahal Indian Kitchen
food_stops.description: A locally-owned restaurant serving fresh and delicious classic Indian dishes.

food_stops.name: Pei Wei Asian Kitchen
food_stops.description: Offers a variety of bold, wok-fired pan-Asian favorites in a fast-casual setting.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~25% SoC. Charge up to ~70% to comfortably reach the final charging stop.

food_stops.name: Taste of India Grill & Bar
food_stops.description: Offers a mix of traditional Indian dishes and unique Indo-American fusion items like Chicken Tikka Pizza.

stops.soc_recommendation: Arrive with ~30% SoC. This is the final top-off. Charge to 80-90% to arrive in Dallas with plenty of range for city driving.

food_stops.name: Sweet Rice Lao-Thai Eats
food_stops.description: A local spot for authentic and flavorful Thai and Laotian cuisine.

rest_areas.name: Tennessee Welcome Center
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 0.3 on I-40 W, Memphis, TN
rest_areas.description: A large welcome center right on the Mississippi River, offering great views before you cross into Arkansas.

rest_areas.name: Social Hill Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Mile Marker 93 on I-30 W, Arkansas
rest_areas.description: A well-maintained and convenient rest stop between Little Rock and Texarkana.

rest_areas.name: Hopkins County Safety Rest Area
rest_areas.location: Near Mile Marker 120 on I-30 W, Texas
rest_areas.description: A modern and clean facility, a good last stop before arriving in the Dallas metro area.

scenic_spots.name: Graceland
scenic_spots.description: A must-do detour. Explore the home of Elvis Presley, the King of Rock 'n' Roll. A major attraction that requires a few hours.

scenic_spots.name: Hot Springs National Park
scenic_spots.description: A significant but worthwhile detour south of Little Rock. Famous for its historic bathhouses and natural hot springs.

scenic_spots.name: Sulphur Springs Glass Bathrooms
scenic_spots.description: A quirky and famous roadside attraction. These public restrooms are made of one-way mirrored glass, so you can see out but no one can see in.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Casey Jones Village
kid_friendly_stops.description: A family-friendly complex featuring a historic railroad museum, an old-timey ice cream parlor, and shops.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Memphis Zoo
kid_friendly_stops.description: A world-class zoo, famous for its giant pandas and diverse animal habitats. A great stop if you detour through Memphis.

kid_friendly_stops.name: Museum of Discovery
kid_friendly_stops.description: A fantastic, hands-on science and technology museum perfect for kids of all ages to explore and learn.
